School named after Betty Soskin, oldest U.S. National Park Ranger, on her 100th birthday

Betty Reid Soskin, America’s oldest living national park ranger and overseer of the Rosie the Riveter National Monument World War II Homefront National Historical Park in Point Richmond, celebrated her 100th birthday on Wednesday by cutting the ribbon at a middle school in El Sobrante.
